channel.title: Comments on: Getting Started with ngCordova
channel.description: Knowing is different & Doing is different

item.title: By: Manikanta
item.dc:creator: Manikanta
item.description: device id not working can anyone help ???
item.content:encoded: device id not working can anyone help ???

item.title: By: h2o
item.dc:creator: h2o
item.description: I just tried this example project, but i have issues on Android. Especially with the SQLite plugin. When I select the SQLite from the side menu, it displays the previously selected menu and then stucks on this menu regardless off selection (so, the menu works, but always shows the last selected menu option before the SQLite selection). My phone is on 4.2.2. Where is the problem?
item.content:encoded:
I just tried this example project, but i have issues on Android.
Especially with the SQLite plugin.
When I select the SQLite from the side menu, it displays the previously selected menu and
then stucks on this menu regardless off selection (so, the menu works, but always shows the
last selected menu option before the SQLite selection).
My phone is on 4.2.2.
Where is the problem?

item.title: By: Neha
item.dc:creator: Neha
item.description: I get this issue Error: device is not defined. it bugs me.Can you tell me how to get rid of it and get this work properly
item.content:encoded: I get this issue Error: device is not defined. it bugs me.Can you tell me how to get rid of it and get this work properly

item.title: By: Mark Aurit
item.dc:creator: Mark Aurit
item.description: Would have been great to see an example of changing of processing (such as changing the template) based on the device orientation (portrait vs landscape)
item.content:encoded: Would have been great to see an example of changing of processing (such as changing the template) based on the device orientation (portrait vs landscape)

item.title: By: Pedro Sacramento
item.dc:creator: Pedro Sacramento
item.description: I just would like to say thank you, and that this is one of the best tutorials I've ever seen in my ~18 years of programming experience. I'm talking seriously. Congratulations for such an effort, I'm sure that it took a long time to write it so clearly and with so many details. Thank you again.
item.content:encoded: I just would like to say thank you, and that this is one of the best tutorials I’ve ever seen in my ~18 years of programming experience. I’m talking seriously. Congratulations for such an effort, I’m sure that it took a long time to write it so clearly and with so many details. Thank you again.

item.title: By: Josh Hicks

item.content:encoded:
Yes. Here’s my stack overflow question about it: http://stackoverflow.com/questions/32056322/cordovafile-method-does-nothing-when-called
I really can’t seem to get the plugin methods to fire.

item.title: By: Arvind Ravulavaru
item.dc:creator: Arvind Ravulavaru
item.description: Are you facing any specific issue while using the API?
item.content:encoded: Are you facing any specific issue while using the API?

item.title: By: Josh Hicks
item.dc:creator: Josh Hicks
item.description: Kind of. I'm really looking for a tutorial on how to use the ngCordova methods like "writeFile()" or "createDir()" in my controllers. For example when you click a save button the "writeFile()" function could be called, saving the $scope data to a json file on the device.
item.content:encoded: Kind of. I’m really looking for a tutorial on how to use the ngCordova methods like “writeFile()” or “createDir()” in my controllers. For example when you click a save button the “writeFile()” function could be called, saving the $scope data to a json file on the device.

item.title: By: Josh Hicks
item.dc:creator: Josh Hicks
item.description: What I meant to say is: do you have any tutorials about using the $codovaFile plugin?
item.content:encoded: What I meant to say is: do you have any tutorials about using the $codovaFile plugin?

item.title: By: Arvind Ravulavaru
item.dc:creator: Arvind Ravulavaru
item.description: Thanks Josh. File plugin to read files?
item.content:encoded: Thanks Josh. File plugin to read files?

item.title: By: Josh Hicks
item.dc:creator: Josh Hicks
item.description: wow, using that $scope.apply() to update the $scope just saved my life!!! Thanks for the awesome tutorial. Do you have any for the ngCordova File plugin?
item.content:encoded: wow, using that $scope.apply() to update the $scope just saved my life!!! Thanks for the awesome tutorial. Do you have any for the ngCordova File plugin?
